comments.body: we should also call NormalizeScore at the end, also for the default_pod_topology_spread.
It's already here but it wasn't in the default_pod_topology_spread. This means that we have only a 3x difference, instead of 5x.
does this really need to be outside the test function?

Technically no. I just moved them as they were - from `priorities/spreading_perf_test.go`, as the intention was to use the same test cases to compare the perf of pod topology spread and default selector spreading. I believe once @alculquicondor done the migration of selector spreading, we can find a better place to hold it.

This is the unfair part to SelectorSpreadPriority.

This calculation should be taken into account in the benchmark.
